How to Convert Square Inches to Square Feet

Converting square inches to square feet is a common task in construction, flooring, and home improvement projects. Our free online calculator makes this conversion simple and accurate.

The Conversion Formula

To convert square inches to square feet, divide the number of square inches by 144:

Square Feet = Square Inches ÷ 144

This works because there are 12 inches in a foot, so there are 12 × 12 = 144 square inches in one square foot.

Common Conversions

Square Inches Square Feet Common Use
144 1 1 square foot
1,440 10 Small room area
14,400 100 Medium room area
43,200 300 Large room area

When to Use This Converter

  • Flooring Projects: Calculate how much flooring material you need
  • Carpeting: Determine carpet square footage for pricing
  • Tile Installation: Convert tile measurements to room coverage
  • Paint Coverage: Calculate wall area for paint estimation
  • Construction: Convert architectural measurements
  • Real Estate: Calculate property square footage

Fraction Support

Our calculator supports various input formats:

  • Whole numbers: 144, 288, 432
  • Decimals: 144.5, 288.75, 432.25
  • Mixed fractions: 144 1/2, 288 3/4, 432 1/4
  • Simple fractions: 289/2, 1155/4, 1729/4

Frequently Asked Questions

How many square inches are in a square foot?

There are 144 square inches in one square foot. This is calculated as 12 inches × 12 inches = 144 square inches.

Can I enter fractions in the calculator?

Yes! Our calculator supports fractions in multiple formats: mixed numbers (144 1/2), simple fractions (289/2), and decimals (144.5).

What's the difference between square inches and square feet?

Square inches and square feet are both units of area measurement. Square feet is a larger unit - one square foot equals 144 square inches.

How do I calculate flooring needs?

Measure your room in square inches, then use our converter to get square feet. Add 10% extra for waste and cuts.

Is this calculator accurate for construction projects?

Yes, our calculator uses precise mathematical formulas and supports fractions for accurate construction measurements.
